qas.question: What is the stated mission of BYU?

answers.text: "is to assist individuals in their quest for perfection and eternal life."

qas.question: What did Brigham Young instruct Karl G. Maeser to not teach even the alphabet without?
What type of institution do BYU leaders consider it to be at heart?
What two types of education does BYU strive to excel in while combining?

plausible_answers.text: "is to assist individuals in their quest for perfection and eternal life."
"I want you to remember that you ought not to teach even the alphabet or the multiplication tables without the Spirit of God."

qas.question: What did Karl G. Maeser tell Brigham Young?
BUY is considered by its leaders to be what?

context: BYU's stated mission <a0_0><b4_0>"is to assist individuals in their quest for perfection and eternal life."<b4_0/><a0_0/> BYU is thus considered by its leaders to be at heart <b6_0>a <a2_0>religious<a2_0/> institution<b6_0/>, wherein, ideally, <a3_0>religious and secular<a3_0/> education are interwoven in a way that encourages the highest standards in both areas. This weaving of the secular and the religious aspects of a religious university goes back as far as Brigham Young himself, who told Karl G. Maeser when the Church purchased the school: <b5_0>"I want you to remember that you ought not to teach even the alphabet or the multiplication tables without <a1_0>the Spirit of God<a1_0/>."
